description: An Indian traveller's heartwarming plan to show his mother snow in Georgia turned sour due to a series of unwelcoming interactions. Despite valid US visa allowing entry, the duo faced subtle disrespect at immigration and their hotel. The experience left them feeling unwelcome, highlighting potential biases faced by travellers from the Global South.

title: SIR: Goa’s final list with 10.57 lakh voters published
UP court orders FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand in sexual exploitation case
description: A special POCSO court in Prayagraj has ordered the police to register an FIR against Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati and his disciple over sexual exploitation allegations. This directive follows a complaint filed by Ashutosh Brahmachari Maharaj. The move occurs amidst ongoing controversy surrounding Swami Avimukteshwaranand, including a recent protest over being prevented from a ritual dip at Sangam.

From Wagner to intelligence service SVR — How Russia rewired its Africa operations
description: Russia's foreign intelligence agency, the SVR, has reportedly taken over Wagner Group's African influence operations post-Prigozhin's death. An investigation reveals the SVR now directs political and information warfare, deploying teams across numerous African nations to spread disinformation and advance Moscow's interests. This strategic shift aims to bolster Russia's presence, particularly in the Sahel region.

'I've best legal team': Indian-American lawyer who argued against Trump tariffs
description: Neal Katyal hailed his legal team as the "best in the world" after the US Supreme Court struck down Donald Trump's global tariffs as illegal. The ruling decisively affirmed that only Congress, not the president, possesses the authority to impose taxes on Americans, reinforcing constitutional governance and the separation of powers.

title: Made in India robot begins trials at Pune Airport: Can speak 85 languages, carry luggage
‘Studying developments’: India’s first reaction to US court order
Jon Cooper provides an encouraging Sidney Crosby Team Canada Olympics gold medal injury update
description: Jon Cooper also provided positive news regarding the injuries of Sidney Crosby prior to the Olympic gold medal match of Team Canada. Crosby is said to be closer to coming back after having missed the semifinal because of a lower-body problem. Canada will test him within the 48 hours, where he is expected to recover and play against Team USA.

title: T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav hints at India's XI vs South Africa in Super Eight
description: Suryakumar Yadav dismissed rumors of Sanju Samson replacing Abhishek Sharma or Tilak Varma, emphasizing confidence in the current lineup. He addressed concerns about Abhishek's form by highlighting the threat he poses to opponents. Yadav also defended Tilak Varma's cautious approach, stating it aligns with team strategy.

title: 'Will not allow Pakistan's dignity to be compromised': Mohsin Naqvi
description: PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi backed Pakistan hockey players after they accused the PHF of abandoning them during the Australia tour. Players said they had no hotel and had to cook and clean themselves, sparking outrage. Naqvi promised full support, financial aid, and help with training, while captain Ammad Shakeel Butt’s suspension is set to be reversed. The incident exposed serious mismanagement in Pakistan hockey.

description: India is closely examining the fallout from the US Supreme Court's decision to strike down President Trump's unilateral tariffs. Following the ruling, Trump announced a new 10% global tariff, asserting that existing national security tariffs remain. He also stated that the trade deal with India, where India pays tariffs, is unaffected.

Chase Elliott net worth: Inside his $12 million salary, sponsorships, and speedway success
description: Chase Elliott's impressive career earnings, estimated at $12 million, stem from more than just race wins. His lucrative Hendrick Motorsports contract, reportedly $8 million annually until 2027, combined with enduring sponsor loyalty from NAPA and Chevrolet, solidifies his status as NASCAR's most marketable star.  His consistent performance and approachable brand build a powerful financial foundation.

description: England captain Harry Brook expressed disappointment over potential exclusions of Pakistani players from The Hundre. He stated it would be a "shame" for the tournament's quality and fan engagement. Several Indian-owned franchises in The Hundred also own IPL teams, where Pakistani players haven't featured since 2009.

description: India will start their Super 8 campaign in the T20 World Cup 2026 against South Africa in Ahmedabad, with coach Morne Morkel confident batters will improve against spin. Despite struggles, India have posted big totals and plan to accelerate after building a base. India also face Zimbabwe and West Indies next. The match starts at 7 PM IST and will be live on Star Sports and Jio Hotstar.

description: President Trump fiercely attacked the Supreme Court after it struck down his tariffs, accusing the justices of being "lapdogs for the radical left" and influenced by foreign interests. He specifically targeted Indian-American attorneys involved in the case. The ruling, a 6-3 decision, reinforced Congress's trade powers, marking a significant setback for the President's executive actions.

description: Reports suggest Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to tie the knot on February 26 in a private Udaipur ceremony, followed by a March 4 Hyderabad reception.  The couple, recently spotted at the airport, is reportedly enhancing security for the three-day festivities, which will include haldi and sangeet.  Their reunion in 'Ranabaali' is also anticipated.

description: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated billions rapidly, but Y Combinator CEO Garry Tan criticizes her approach, calling it "bad" due to a lack of oversight and accountability. Tan argues this "spray and pray" method can lead to mismanagement and unintended negative consequences for recipient organizations.

description: A Delhi court granted police five-day custody of four Youth Congress workers who staged a shirtless protest at the AI summit venue. Police allege a conspiracy to defame India, citing anti-national slogans and T-shirts targeting the Prime Minister. Investigators are probing potential foreign funding and a larger plot, with three officers reportedly injured during the incident.

The $170Bn question: US SC junks Trump tariffs, but who will get the refunds?
description: The Supreme Court invalidated Trump's tariffs, leaving billions in collected duties in limbo. While the administration previously promised refunds, the process remains unclear, with individual importers potentially needing to file lawsuits. This ruling, which affirmed Congress's power to tax, has left companies and countries awaiting further guidance.

title: 1 in 7 stroke patients in India under 45 years
description: Over Half Dead Or Disabled In Three Months

title: 'It is not the handsomest or strongest men who are...': Quote of the day by Aristotle
description: Aristotle, a pivotal figure in Western philosophy, moved from Plato's abstract Forms to empirical observation, influencing science, ethics, and politics. He established the Lyceum, developed logic and metaphysics, and emphasized virtue and practical wisdom for achieving eudaimonia, or human flourishing. His enduring legacy lies in making philosophy practical and accessible.

title: Olympic speedskater Kamila Sellier cut in fall, eye reportedly safe
description: Kamila Sellier suffered a frightening facial injury during the women’s 1,500-meter short-track quarterfinal at the 2026 Winter Olympics after a collision caused by an illegal pass. She received stitches and further medical care, while Kristen Santos-Griswold was penalized. The incident paused the event and deeply affected competitors and spectators. Racing later resumed, but Sellier’s injury became one of the most sobering moments of the Games.

title: Two people of Gujarati-origin face sex crime charges in US
'Inform parents': Gujarat may tweak marriage norms
FBI warns of ATM Jackpotting incidents across America: All you need to know
description: The FBI has issued a warning about ATM jackpotting malware, like Ploutus, which allows threat actors to dispense cash by exploiting physical and software vulnerabilities.  These attacks bypass bank authorization, leading to significant financial losses.  The FBI urges organizations to implement mitigation steps and report suspicious activity.

title: 'Lured with games & gifts': UP couple gets death for sexually abusing 33 boys, selling their videos
description: A Pocso court in Banda, Uttar Pradesh, has sentenced a former government engineer and his wife to death for sexually abusing 33 boys over a decade. The couple also sold videos and pictures of their torture on the dark web. The court deemed the crimes "rarest of rare" due to the extreme trauma inflicted on the young victims.

title: 14-year-old Dalit girl dies by suicide after molester gets bail
description: A 14-year-old Dalit girl in Lakhimpur Kheri was found dead after allegedly being threatened by a man accused of molesting her, who was recently released on bail. Her family claims she was under immense stress following the threats. An FIR has been registered against the accused for abetment of suicide and under the SC/ST Act.
